Description: Three studies of figures pulling, man with drum and two heads for the painting 'Israel in Egypt' in the Guildhall Art Gallery, London (acc.no 1014); figures pulling all half-length, with upper body bare, figure with drum hanging from shoulders, three-quarter length and standing in profile to left, both heads turned to right, one in profile Black and white chalk; on brown paper
Curator's comments: The painting was exhibited at the Royal Academy in 1867 (no.434).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Edward John Poynter (Executors of)
Purchased through: Charles Francis Bell (for Executors)
